SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Logic.States.GameState
Direct Known Subclasses:
ASynchronousGameState, SynchronousGameState
public abstract class GameState extends Object
Represents a state in the game where specific actions can be performed.
This abstract class defines methods for the various actions that can be taken during a game and provides a default implementation for some of them.

  • Method Details

    • playCard

      public void playCard(Player player, int cardIndex, int coordinateIndex, boolean faceUp) throws MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException, NotYourTurnException, InvalidActionForPlayerStateException, InvalidActionForGameStateException, InvalidGameInputException
      Attempts to play a card. The default implementation throws an exception as this action is not allowed in the current state. Subclasses can override this method to define the behavior for playing a card in the specific state.
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to place the card.
      cardIndex - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      coordinateIndex - The index of the available coordinate in the cardMap where the card will be placed.
      faceUp - True if the card should be placed face up, false if face down.
      Throws:
      MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException - If the move is attempted in a wait state.
      NotYourTurnException - If it is not the player's turn.
      InvalidActionForPlayerStateException - If the action is invalid for the player's state.
      InvalidActionForGameStateException - If the action is not allowed in the current game state.
      InvalidGameInputException

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Player player, CardPoolTypes cardPoolType, int index) throws MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException, NotYourTurnException, InvalidActionForPlayerStateException, InvalidActionForGameStateException, MaxGoldenCardsDrawnException, MaxResourceCardsDrawnException
      Attempts to draw a card. The default implementation throws an exception as this action is not allowed in the current state. Subclasses can override this method to define the behavior for drawing a card in the specific state.
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to draw the card.
      cardPoolType - The type of card pool from which the card will be drawn.
      index - The index of the card in the card pool.
      Throws:
      MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException - If the move is attempted in a wait state.
      NotYourTurnException - If it is not the player's turn.
      InvalidActionForPlayerStateException - If the action is invalid for the player's state.
      InvalidActionForGameStateException - If the action is not allowed in the current game state.
      MaxGoldenCardsDrawnException - If the player has drawn the maximum number of golden cards.
      MaxResourceCardsDrawnException - If the player has drawn the maximum number of resource cards.

    • pickPlayerObjective

      public void pickPlayerObjective(Player player, int objectiveIndex) throws MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException, InvalidActionForPlayerStateException, InvalidActionForGameStateException
      Attempts to pick a player objective. The default implementation throws an exception as this action is not allowed in the current state. Subclasses can override this method to define the behavior for picking a player objective in the specific state.
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to pick the objective.
      objectiveIndex - The index of the objective the player is picking.
      Throws:
      MoveAttemptOnWaitStateException - If the move is attempted in a wait state.
      InvalidActionForPlayerStateException - If the action is invalid for the player's state.
      InvalidActionForGameStateException - If the action is not allowed in the current game state.

    • shouldRemovePlayerOnDisconnect

      public boolean shouldRemovePlayerOnDisconnect()
      Determines if the player should be removed from the game upon disconnection. The default implementation returns true, Subclasses can override this method if they want to implement resilience to disconnections.
      Returns:
      True if the player should be removed on disconnection, false otherwise.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Player player)
      Removes a player from the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to remove.

    • userDisconnectionProcedure

      public void userDisconnectionProcedure(Player player)
      Handles disconnection of a user from the game.
      This method prepares the game for later player removal, it does not directly remove the player (the removal will be triggered by the outside lobby by calling the remove method).
      Parameters:
      player - The user who disconnected.

    • userReconnectionProcedure

      public void userReconnectionProcedure(Player player)
      Handles the reconnection of a player to the game.
      Classes that override this method should send to the reconnecting player all the packets containing Player specific information regarding state specific variables.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who reconnected.

    • quit

      public void quit(Player player)
      Handles a player's request to quit the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player requesting to quit.

    • toRecord

      public GameRecord toRecord()
      Converts the current game state to a GameRecord.
      Returns:
      A GameRecord representing the current game state.

    • nextState

      protected abstract void nextState()
      Advances the game to the next state. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the transition to the next state.
